msContents.summary: C1, 2 Is a sale of a half part of a house by Patous the younger to his daughter-in-law, Tikas.

condition.ab: The papyrus has a dark brown color. It is badly damaged as a result of at least 6 folds. The upper margin, about 10 cm, survives. Some restoration needs to be done on this papyrus. (MA)

origin.persName: Timotheos (son of) Timotheos, Prax[in]ike, daughter of Philinos,
Patous the young, (son) of Patous, (his) mother (being) Esenrenphis
Tikas, daughter of Teos, her mother (being) Tanas
Paneith the younger, son of Orses

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Philadelphia; T;-nhy; division of Heraklides; Aphroditopolis; As a part of a Goddess name.

div.ab: (1) Year 20, [Hathur], . . . of Pharaoh] Ptolemy, [so of] Ptolemy and Arsinoe the gods who love their father, the priest of Al[ex]ander and the brother gods [and the] beneficent gods and the gods [who love] their father and the gods [who appear (being) Timo]theos (2) (son of) Timotheos, Prax[in]ike, daughter of Philinos, (being) the bearer of the gift of victory before Ber[enic]e the beneficent goddess, He[dul]le, daughter of Ptolemy, (being) [the bearer of] the golden basket before Ars[inoe] the brother loving, the woman Biren[e, daughter of] Ptolemy, (being) the priestess of A[rsi]noe (who loves] her [father].;Has said the, the servant of Hathor-mistress-of-Aphroditopolis Isis, [the great goddess], Patous the young, (son) of Patous, [(his) mother (being) [Esen]renphis], to the woman Tikas, daughter of Teos, her mother (being) Ta[n]as:;[I am] far from thee in regard to [thy] half part [of] the house (4) which is built, being covered [with [roof and] beams, being complete with door, together with the half part of its courtyard which of south of it, [which] [pertains to it, and its] eastern wall, measuring 25 divine cubits south to north by 6 . . . . divine cubits east to west, which is in the southeastern quarter of (5) the Sobk town of Philadelphia [ . . . . . . . . . . ] T;-nhy which is in [the] division of Herakides, which is on the north bank of the canal [Mo]eris, in the [nome] of A[rsinoe].;The neighbors of thy [half part] aforesaid: [south, the half part of] the house together with the [half part of its] courtyard [ . . . . . . . .] (6) [ . . . . . north, . . . . . . . . east, . . . . . . . .] . . [Nechthpharous], [. . ] [;]ln, [his] [. . .] west, the other [half] part [of the house . . . . . . . ] . . . . courtyard [ . . . . . . . .] which I sold to [[ . . . . . Pa]neith the younger, [son of Orses . . . . . .] [ . . . . . . . ] . . . [ . . . . ] to thee written . . . . (son of) . . . .;. . . . (son of) . . . .;Petesuchos, (son of) [Necht] [ . . . .];Teos, (son of) Hor;. . . . (son of) ȤAmennais;. . . . (son of) . . . .
